intro: Scaphyglottis ruberrima, commonly known as the scarlet bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many species of bellflowers. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are upright and branching. Scaphyglottis ruberrima is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and vibrant floral display.
